Notifications.SystemSupportFound: System support found! Applying default system settings to Item Piles
Notifications.CreatedJournal: Created the Item Piles Vault Log journal.

Errors.DisallowedItemSell: This merchant does not accept "{type}" items
Errors.NoSourceDrop: You cannot drop items from the item bar unless you are a GM.
Errors.PileTooFar: You're too far away to interact with this pile.
Errors.NoTokenFound: Could not find a token or character to represent you.
Errors.PileLocked: This container is locked and cannot be opened - you can't drop items in it.
Errors.DropNoToken: You don't have a token on this scene, so you can't drop any items here.
Errors.NoVaultAccess: You don't have permission to view this vault.
Errors.NoVaultAccessActor: {actor_name} doesn't have permission to view this vault.
Errors.ItemNoQuantity: {item_name} has 0 quantity, so you can't transfer this item!

Warnings.NoGMsConnected: WARNING - No GMs connected - Item Piles requires a GM to be connected for players to be able to utilize most of the module's features.
Warnings.NoResponseFromGM: WARNING - GM "{user_name}" did not respond to request - Item Piles requires a GM to be connected and response in order for players to be able to utilize most of the module's features.
Warnings.NoResponseFromGMTimeout: WARNING - GM "{user_name}" did not respond to last request - please wait {time} seconds before making another Item Piles request.
Warnings.TransactionNoGMConnected: No GM is connected - current transaction has been cancelled, nothing has been added, removed, or transferred
Warnings.GiveItemNoGM: There is no GM active to receive you giving this item.
Warnings.NoPlayersActive: No players are active to do this action
Warnings.NoGMsConnectedAction: WARNING - Could not execute "{action}" because no GMs are active.
Warnings.VaultFull: This item can't fit into this vault!
Warnings.CantSortVault: Failed to sort items - either there are simply too many items, or something went wrong
Warnings.VaultItemNotExpander: That item is not a vault expander
Warnings.DroppedIsNotItem: You can't drop documents of type "{type}" into this item pile!
Warnings.VaultInvalidItemDropped: You cannot drop this type of item into this vault!
Warnings.VaultSameItemOrigin: You can't drop items into the vault that originate from the vault!
Warnings.VaultNoGmItemSidebar: Only GMs can drop items from the sidebar!
Warnings.LogEmpty: The log for "{actor_name}" is empty and has nothing to export

Inspect.Title: Inspecting Pile Contents
Inspect.Owner: As an owner of this Item Pile, you can edit the item pile's contents.
Inspect.Destroyed: This pile no longer exists and lies barren.
Inspect.SplitNoPlayers: No characters were found to split the contents with.

Trade.Title: Item Piles: Trading
Trade.AutoDecline: You did not respond to the trade request quickly enough, so it was auto-declined.
Trade.Declined: The other user declined the trade request.
Trade.SameActor: Both users cannot pick the same character - you can't trade to AND from the same character. Stop it.
Trade.PrivateExplanation: No chat card are posted, and no one can spectate
Trade.Over: This trade is no longer active.
Trade.DragDrop: Drag & drop items to begin trading

Prompt.Title: Item Piles: Send Trade Request
Prompt.User: Select which user you want to trade with:
Prompt.PickActor: Select which actor you will represent in the trade:
Prompt.PickedActor: The actor that you will represent in the trade:
Prompt.Label: Send trade request

NoActiveUsers.Title: Item Piles: No Active Users
NoActiveUsers.Content: No players are active, so you have no one to trade with.

CancelledRequest.Content: The trade request was cancelled by {user_name}.

AddCurrency.Title: Add Currencies
AddCurrency.Content: Add currencies to the active trade with {trader_actor_name}
AddCurrency.Label: Update Currencies

Closed.Title: Trade Closed
Closed.You: You closed the trading window, so the trade was cancelled.
Closed.Them: User "{user_name}" closed the trading window, so the trade was cancelled.
Closed.Someone: One of the users closed the trading window, so the trade was cancelled.

Trade.Disconnected: One of the users was disconnected, so the trade was cancelled.
Trade.UserCharacterWarning:
You picked the actor "{actor_name}" which is the assigned character of the player "{player_name}".

Are you sure you want to do this?
Trade.UserActiveCharacterWarning:
You picked the actor "{actor_name}" which is the assigned character of the player "{player_name}", who is active.

Are you sure you want to do this?
Trade.ActorOwnerWarning: You do not own this actor, so you cannot trade with it.

Merchant.Title: Merchant: {actor_name}
Merchant.NoItemsToSell: You have nothing to sell to this merchant
Merchant.MerchantClosed: Merchant is closed, check back later.
Merchant.EditTypePricesExplanation: Toggle the visibility of per-type sliders in the Buy Items tab
Merchant.NoRollTables: No roll tables exist, create one to get started

Vault.NeedsCapacity: This vault has a total capacity of {total_capacity}, but none of it is available until vault expanders are added
Vault.CapacityLeft: This vault has a capacity of {capacity}, with a maximum of {total_capacity}, drag and drop vault expanders to increase capacity
Vault.CapacityFull: This vault has reached its maximum capacity of {total_capacity}
Vault.SortItemsTooltip: Sort items - hold Ctrl to merge similar items

TypeWarning.Title: Item Type Warning
TypeWarning.DropContent: You're dropping an item that is of a type ("{type}") that is normally not allowed to be dropped. Are you sure you want to do this?
TypeWarning.TradeContent: You're attempting to trade an item that is of a type ("{type}") that is normally not allowed to be traded. Are you sure you want to do this?
TypeWarning.SellContent: You're attempting to sell item of type ("{type}") that the merchant normally doesn't accept. Are you sure you want to do this?

ResetSettings.Title: Reset Module Settings
ResetSettings.Content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the Item Piles module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!

LinkedActorWarning.Title: Item Piles & Linked Actor
LinkedActorWarning.Content: Are you sure you want to turn this linked actor into an item pile? This actor's token is linked and all tokens of this actor will share its inventory and currencies.

NoSystemFound.Title: System Not Recognized
NoSystemFound.Content:
This system is not supported.

This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, take a screenshot of the dialog that opens after you close this, and ask for assistance in your system's channel on the Foundry discord.

NewSystemVersion.Title: New System Version
NewSystemVersion.Content: The default settings for the system you're using with Item Piles was updated, would you like to override your system specific settings with the updated ones?
NewSystemVersion.Content2: Not doing this may break Item Piles - you reset the module's system specific settings to fix it.

ResetSharingData.Title: Reset Sharing Data
ResetSharingData.Content:
This will reset all of the history of players having taken their share from this pile.

Are you sure you want to do this?

ClearAllItems.Title: Clear All Actor Items
ClearAllItems.Content: This will clear all of the merchant's items, are you sure you want to do this?

ClearAllServices.Title: Clear All Actor Services
ClearAllServices.Content: This will clear all of the merchant's services, are you sure you want to do this?

GiveItemUserNotActive.Title: Giving Item
GiveItemUserNotActive.Content: "{actor_name}" is owned by the player "{user_name}" but they are not active, so you cannot give them this item.

RemoveMerchantTable.Title: Remove Merchant Table
RemoveMerchantTable.Content: Are you sure you want to remove the "{table_name}" table from this merchant? This is not undoable.

CantRemoveVaultExpander.Title: Cannot Remove Expander
CantRemoveVaultExpander.Content: You cannot remove this expander, the items in the vault would not fit without it. Remove {num_items} items before trying to remove this expander!

GiveItems.Title: Giving Items
GiveItems.SelectPlaceholder: Pick character to send item to
GiveItems.ContentMultipleQuantity: You have {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to give away?
GiveItems.Secret: Give without letting others know (except GMs)

ReceiveItem.Title: Receiving Item
ReceiveItem.Content: {source_actor_name} wants to give an item to {target_actor_name}, do you accept?

ClearVaultLog.Title: Clear Vault Log?
ClearVaultLog.Content: Are you sure you want to clear the log of the vault "{actor_name}"?

ClearMerchantLog.Title: Clear Merchant Log?
ClearMerchantLog.Content: Are you sure you want to clear the log of the merchant "{actor_name}"?

SortMergeVaultItems.Title: Sort & Merge Similar Items?
SortMergeVaultItems.Content: Are you sure you want to merge similar items while sorting them? The merge cannot be undone.

DropItem.Title: Dropping Item
DropItem.Content: You're adding this item to the item pile "{target_name}".
DropItem.ContentMultipleQuantity: You have {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to drop?
DropItem.ContentInfiniteQuantity: How many do you want to drop?

GiveItem.Title: Giving Item
GiveItem.Content: Do you want to give this item to "{target_name}"?
GiveItem.ContentMultipleQuantity: You have {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to give away?
GiveItem.ContentInfiniteQuantity: How many do you want to give to "{target_name}"?

DepositItem.Title: Deposit Item
DepositItem.Content: Do you want to deposit this item into "{target_name}"?
DepositItem.ContentMultipleQuantity: You have {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to deposit?
DepositItem.ContentInfiniteQuantity: How many do you want to deposit?

WithdrawItem.Title: Withdraw Item
WithdrawItem.Content: Do you want to withdraw this item from "{target_name}"?
WithdrawItem.ContentMultipleQuantity: There's {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to withdraw?

SplitItem.Title: Split Item Stack
SplitItem.Content: Do you want to split this stacked item?
SplitItem.ContentMultipleQuantity: There's {quantity} of this item, how many do you want in the new stack?

EditCurrencies.Title: Editing Currencies
EditCurrencies.Content: As a GM, you can update the currencies on this item pile:

DropCurrencies.Title: Dropping Currencies
DropCurrencies.Content: You can add the following currencies into this item pile:

DepositCurrencies.Title: Deposit Currencies
DepositCurrencies.Content: You can deposit the following currencies into this vault:

WithdrawCurrencies.Title: Withdraw Item
WithdrawCurrencies.Content: You can withdraw the following currencies from this vault:
WithdrawCurrencies.NoCurrency: There are no currencies to withdraw.

TradeMerchantItem.Title: Trading Item: {item_name}
TradeMerchantItem.YouLackQuantity: You do not have enough of this item to sell, you have {quantity}, but require {requiredQuantity}
TradeMerchantItem.TheyLackQuantity: They do not have enough of this item to sell, they have {quantity}, but require {requiredQuantity}

Settings.Title: Item Piles Module Configuration
Settings.Donate: If you like this module, consider donating to keep it running!
Settings.MoreToCome: And with more configuration options to come...

CurrenciesEditor.Title: Item Piles Currencies Editor
CurrenciesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define which currencies on characters that can be picked up from item piles, such as currencies.
CurrenciesEditor.ExplanationSmallAttributes: In D&D5e, currencies exist on actors on the attribute path "actor.system.currency.gp", so you'd add your own with the name "Gold Coins" and attribute path "system.currency.gp". Add one by clicking the plus in the header.
CurrenciesEditor.ExplanationSmallItems: In other systems, they may be actual items on the actor - in this case, you can drag and drop items onto this list to add it to the currencies.
CurrenciesEditor.DragDrop: Drag and drop an item to add it to the list
CurrenciesEditor.Name: Currency name
CurrenciesEditor.CreateNew: Drop an item or click the plus button to get started!

SecondaryCurrenciesEditor.Title: Item Piles Secondary Currencies Editor
SecondaryCurrenciesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define which secondary currencies that can be picked up and dropped by characters.

GeneralTab.NotForSaleExplanation: When enabled, this item is not for sale and cannot be bought. It still shows up in the merchant's item list unless the item is also hidden.
GeneralTab.CustomCategoryExplanation: When not blank, this item will be listed under a different type than what it is.
GeneralTab.HiddenExplanation: When enabled, this item does not show up in the merchant's item lists.
GeneralTab.CanStackExplanation: This configures whether this item will stack with other items that are similar to it.
GeneralTab.DisplayQuantityExplanation: This configures how the quantity this item in the store is shown, if at all.
GeneralTab.InfiniteQuantityExplanation: When enabled, this item cannot run out of quantity when sold by a merchant.
GeneralTab.KeepZeroExplanation: When fully sold out, the merchant does not remove this item but sets it to not for sale instead.
GeneralTab.KeepOnMerchantExplanation: When the items are cleared in the populate items tab of merchants or by the Simple Calendar refresh inventory integration (see the merchant config at the bottom), this item will always remain.
GeneralTab.PriceExplanation: In this tab, you can configure the price of this item, including whether this item will cost other items to purchase.

PriceTab.BasePriceExplanation: This configures the normal price of this item.
PriceTab.QuantityForPriceExplanation: This configures how many of this item one should get when purchasing this item.
PriceTab.ServiceExplanation: This causes this item to not add any item to the buyer's inventory. The service "item" can still have quantity, but if it runs out it will not be deleted from the merchant, but set to not for sale instead.
PriceTab.PurchaseMacroExplanation: Name of macro to execute when the item is purchased.
PriceTab.FreeExplanation: When enabled, this item does not cost any money to purchase from the merchant.
PriceTab.DisableNormalCostExplanation: When this is enabled, the item cannot be purchased with the primary currency and must be purchased with one of the purchase options below.
PriceTab.PurchaseOptionsAsSellOptionExplanation: When this is enabled, the purchase options below can be used when selling the item back to a merchant. By default, only the sell options below can be used.
PriceTab.PurchaseOptionsExplanation: Here you can configure the alternate ways to purchase this item. Each group represents a different way that a character can buy this item from merchants.
PriceTab.SellOptionsExplanation: Here you can configure the alternate ways to sell this item. Each group represents a different way that a character can sell this item to merchants.
PriceTab.CantBeSoldToMerchantsExplanation: When enabled, this item cannot be sold back to merchants, only purchased.
PriceTab.DropMeClickMe: Click to add an attribute or drag & drop an item to add
PriceTab.OverheadCostOptionsExplanation: Here you can configure an overhead cost that is always added to the price of this item when a merchant sells it. This is affected by price modifiers.

VaultTab.GridSizeExplanation: This configures how many grid spaces this item takes up.
VaultTab.VaultImageExplanation: This overrides the item's image when displayed in a vault.
VaultTab.VaultImageRotatedExplanation: This overrides the item's image when displayed in a vault while it is rotated.
VaultTab.VaultExpanderExplanation: When this is enabled, this item does not act as a normal item in a vault, it instead increases the number of available slots, as determined below.
VaultTab.ExpandColumnsRowsExplanation: When the above setting is enabled, this sets how many columns and/or rows becomes available in the vault. This cannot extend beyond the capacity of the vault.
VaultTab.PriceModifierExplanation: This configures the modifiers for the cost this item when bought and sold. This multiplies the base price of the item before any other price modifiers. If the sell price modifier of the merchant is 50%, the sell price modifier of the item would have to be 200% in order to nullify the merchant modifier.

FilterEditor.Title: Item Piles Filters Editor
FilterEditor.Explanation: Here you can define multiple types of filters that will exclude certain types of items. Based on the attribute path given, the item pile could find the "type" of an item and based on the filters, it hides those items in the item pile inventory UI.

RequiredItemPropertiesEditor.Title: Item Piles - Required Item Properties Editor
RequiredItemPropertiesEditor.TitleActor: Item Piles - Required Item Properties Editor: {actor_name}
RequiredItemPropertiesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define multiple types of required item properties that items transferred to this item pile must have. Based on the attribute path given, the item pile could find the "type" of an item and based on the requirements, it would prevent transferring items that do not match these properties to this item pile.

SimilaritiesEditor.Title: Item Piles Similarities Editor
SimilaritiesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define multiple types of identifiers that helps Item Piles differentiate between similar items. In almost every system, items can be differentiated with their "name" and "type". But in some cases, such as in Pathfinder 2nd Edition, temporary items may share those with permanent items. So by adding "system.temporary.value", your temporary items are considered "unique" and separate from permanent ones.

CustomItemCategoriesEditor.Title: Custom Item Categories Editor
CustomItemCategoriesEditor.Explanation: Here you can configure which custom item categories are available in your world. They are dynamically added to when you add a new one for an item.

UnstackableItemTypesEditor.Title: Unstackable Item Types Editor
UnstackableItemTypesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define which types items that cannot be stacked.

VaultStylesEditor.Title: Item Piles Vault Styles Editor
VaultStylesEditor.Explanation: Here you can define multiple styles for items in vaults. For example, you can make a style look at "system.rarity" to be "rare", and apply a style onto to items that matches the setup.

ItemTypePriceModifiersEditor.Title: Item Type Price Modifiers Editor
ItemTypePriceModifiersEditor.Explanation: Here you can define the price and sell price modifiers for this merchant relating to specific item types. The "Override" setting means that it overrides the merchant's normal price modifiers.

PriceModifiersEditor.Title: Item Piles Price Modifiers Editor
PriceModifiersEditor.Explanation: Here you can define the price and sell price modifiers for this merchant relating to specific actors. The "Override" setting means that it overrides the merchant's normal price modifiers, including item-type specific price modifiers.
PriceModifiersEditor.DragDrop: Drag and drop an actor to add it to the list

Main.Title: Main Settings
Main.EnabledPileExplanation: Whether this should act as an item pile.
Main.InspectItemsExplanation: Clicking item names will open the item's sheet.
Main.DisplayItemTypesExplanation: Display each type of item separately in the item pile, sorted by their item type.
Main.MacroExplanation: Name of macro to execute when this pile is interacted with.
Main.EditDescriptionExplanation: This description is shown in relevant interfaces when the item pile is viewed
Main.DeleteWhenEmptyExplanation: Causes this item pile to auto-delete itself once it's empty.
Main.CanStackItemsExplanation: With this setting, items added to the item pile will stack with similar items. This can also be controlled per-item in their configuration. Note: This is dependent on the system as well, since some items do not have quantity so they can never be stacked.
Main.CanStackItemsYes: Yes, stack items (unless item says otherwise)
Main.CanStackItemsNo: No, stack items (unless item says otherwise)
Main.OverrideCurrenciesExplanation: Configure if this pile should be able to transfer other currencies than the default.
Main.OverrideSecondaryCurrenciesExplanation: Configure this item pile's secondary currency overrides.
Main.OverrideItemFiltersExplanation: Configure if this pile should be able to transfer other types items than the default.
Main.RequiredItemPropertiesExplanation: Configure if this item pile should require items that are transferred to it must have certain properties.

Other.Title: Other Settings
Other.TypeExplanation: This configures the way this item pile will be displayed.

SingleItem.Title: Single Item Settings
SingleItem.DisplayOneContainerWarning: Warning! You have both "Display Single Item Image" and "Is Container" enabled. In this case, the container images takes priority.
SingleItem.DisplayOneExplanation: If the pile is made up of a single item, this sets the pile token's image to be the image of the item.
SingleItem.ItemNameExplanation: Causes the item pile to be named after the single item it contains.

Sharing.Title: Sharing Settings
Sharing.ShareItemsEnabledExplanation: When this is enabled, players can only take their share of the quantities of items. Disabled means they can take as much as they want.
Sharing.ShareCurrenciesEnabledExplanation: When this is enabled, players can only take their share of the quantities of currencies. Disabled means they can take as much as they want.
Sharing.TakeAllEnabledExplanation: Enables the "Take All" button when looting this item pile. Requires both of the above sharing settings to be disabled.
Sharing.SplitAllEnabledExplanation: Enables the "Split [number] ways" button when looting this item pile. Pressing this button makes all players (or only active players, see below) receive their share of the item pile.
Sharing.InactivePlayersExplanation: Only players who are active when this item pile is looted will be given their share of the pile.
Sharing.ResetSharingDataExplanation: If the Item Pile's content was manually changed while people were looting it, the sharing data may become out of sync with the players' actual shares. Pressing this button will reset everyone's share in this pile.

Merchant.Title: Merchant Settings
Merchant.EnabledExplanation: Players cannot pick up items from merchants, but must instead purchase them
Merchant.MerchantImageExplanation: This is the image that will be displayed in the merchant's interface
Merchant.InfiniteQuantityExplanation: When enabled, this merchant cannot run out of items.
Merchant.InfiniteCurrencyExplanation: When enabled, selling items to this merchant will not subtract from its currencies.
Merchant.KeepZeroExplanation: When items are fully sold out, this merchant will not remove them but instead sets them to not for sale instead.
Merchant.DisplayQuantityExplanation: This configures how the quantity of items in the store is shown, if at all.
Merchant.DisplayQuantityYes: Yes, show quantity (unless item says otherwise)
Merchant.DisplayQuantityNo: No, hide quantity (unless item says otherwise)
Merchant.PurchaseOnlyExplanation: When enabled, characters cannot sell items to this merchant.
Merchant.HideNewItemsExplanation: When enabled, any items sold to this merchant will be hidden.
Merchant.HideItemsWithZeroCostExplanation: When enabled, this makes it so that customers cannot buy or sell items that have a cost of zero (free).
Merchant.OnlyAcceptBasePriceExplanation: When enabled, all items sold to this merchant must use the base price, and not any custom prices.
Merchant.OnlyAcceptCustomPricesExplanation: When enabled, all items sold to this merchant must use the custom prices for that item (if any), and not the regular currencies. If the item does not have a custom price, it cannot be sold.
Merchant.OpenTimesExplanation: When enabled, the merchant is can only be interacted by players at certain times of the day.
Merchant.OpenStatusExplanation: This configures the current state of the merchant's open status. If Open Times (below) is enabled, and the Simple Calendar module is enabled, you can configure this to be automatic.
Merchant.HideTokenWhenClosedExplanation: When this is enabled, the token(s) of this merchant are hidden when closed.
Merchant.ClosedDaysExplanation: On the days checked, the merchant will be closed (if the merchant open status is set to automatic).
Merchant.ClosedHolidaysExplanation: On days where there are notes with the given note category, the merchant will be closed (if the merchant open status is set to automatic).
Merchant.RefreshItemsWarning: With every options below, existing items will be DELETED and cannot be recovered. Individual items can be configured to be kept; items set to services, keep zero quantity, and keep on merchant will stay.
Merchant.RefreshItemsOnOpen: Refresh Items At Open Time (Simple Calendar)
Merchant.RefreshItemsOnOpenExplanation: When the calendar's time goes beyond the opening time of the merchant, the merchant's inventory will be refreshed.
Merchant.RefreshItemsDaysExplanation: When the calendar passes the checked days, the merchant's inventory will be refreshed. This happens on the opening time of the merchant, or at midnight if it doesn't have an open/close time.
Merchant.RefreshItemsHolidaysExplanation: When the calendar passes notes with the given note category, the merchant's inventory will be refreshed. This happens on the note's time, or at midnight if it is a note that is set to all day.
Merchant.PriceModifierExplanation: This configures the modifiers for the cost of every item in the shop. You can also configure modifiers per item type, and even for specific characters (such as silver-tongued bards). You are not limited to 200%, type into the field to go even higher.
Merchant.ItemTypeModifiersExplanation: In this dialog you can configure price modifiers for individual item types.
Merchant.ActorPriceModifiersExplanation: Here you can configure if certain specific actors should have different price modifiers than the price modifiers above.
Merchant.MerchantColumnsExplanation: Here you can configure this merchant's system specific columns displayed in its merchant UI, such as the rarity of items.
Merchant.LogMerchantActivityExplanation: When enabled, this causes the merchant to log events such as buying and selling items, and GMs updating the status (quantity, visibility, and for sale) of items.
Merchant.ClearMerchantLogExplanation: This will clear the merchant logs, removing all entries. This cannot be undone.
Merchant.ExportMerchantLogExplanation: This will export and download a text file log of the logs, sorted in oldest to newest information.
Merchant.OverheadCostOptionsExplanation: Here you can configure an overhead cost that is always added to the price of items when the merchant sells them. This is affected by price modifiers.

Vault.Title: Vault Settings
Vault.LayoutExplanation: This is how many columns and rows should be visible in the vault.
Vault.EnableExpansionExplanation: With this enabled, items that are configured as vault expanders will expand the vault's available space.
Vault.BaseExpansionExplanation: This is how many columns and rows are enabled by default without any expansion items.
Vault.RestrictAccessExplanation: By default, everyone can access vaults if they can see them in the sidebar or can get next to them on a scene. When this setting is enabled, the vault will only be viewable by either the owner of the vault character or users/characters set up in the Access Editor (see below).
Vault.AccessExplanation: This configures which characters & players can access and modify the vault's inventory & currencies. If a player has ownership of the vault character, they always have full access.
Vault.LogVaultAccessExplanation: When enabled, this vault will create a journal entry and create timestamped logs any time the vault is interacted with.
Vault.ClearVaultLogExplanation: This will clear the vault logs, removing all entries. This cannot be undone.
Vault.LoggingFormatExplanation: This configures how the username and character name are displayed in the log.

VaultAccessEditor.Title: Vault Access Editor
VaultAccessEditor.Explanation: This configures which characters & players can access and modify the vault's inventory & currencies. If a player has ownership of the vault character, they always have full access.

MerchantColumnsEditor.Title: Merchant Columns
MerchantColumnsEditor.Explanation: This configures the columns visible in the merchant UI, beyond the name of the item, the quantity, and the price.
MerchantColumnsEditor.Label: Label
MerchantColumnsEditor.MappingContent: This configures the mapping between the value of the property to a label. This label can be a localized string.

PricePresetEditor.Title: Price Presets Editor
PricePresetEditor.Explanation: Here you can create multiple preset prices that can then be easily used in items' custom prices.

Chat.Split: An item pile's content was split among {num_players} players, and each one has received:
Chat.TradeStartedButton: Click the button below to spectate:

Configure.Title: Module Configuration
Configure.Label: Configure Module
Configure.Hint: You can configure Item Piles in this dialog.

Reset.Title: Reset System Specific Settings To Default
Reset.Label: Reset Settings
Reset.Hint: This will reset all of the settings of Item Piles back to the active game system's default.

ActorClass.Title: Actor class type
ActorClass.Hint: This setting defines the type of actor that will be used for the default item pile actor that is created on first item drop. In the case of D&D5e, this is "character", as it does not have a dedicated loot actor type.

ItemLootClass.Title: Item Loot class type
ItemLootClass.Hint: The item class type is the type of item that will be used for the default loot item.

ItemWeaponClass.Title: Item Weapon class type
ItemWeaponClass.Hint: The item class type is the type of item that will be used for the default weapon item.

ItemEquipmentClass.Title: Item Equipment class type
ItemEquipmentClass.Hint: The item class type is the type of item that will be used for the default equipment item.

Quantity.Title: Item quantity attribute
Quantity.Hint: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each item's quantity. For example, in D&D5e system, each item's quantity is stored in the item's "item.system.quantity" attribute, so you'd put "system.quantity" in this setting.

Price.Title: Item price attribute
Price.Hint: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each item's price. For example, in D&D5e system, each item's quantity is stored in the item's "item.system.price" attribute, so you'd put "system.price" in this setting.

QuantityForPrice.Title: Quantity of item for price attribute
QuantityForPrice.Hint: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for the amount of items you get for the price. For example, in PF2e system, there's a "per" property on items, which determines what quantity of items you get for the item's price, which stored in the item's "item.system.price.per" attribute, so you'd put "system.price.per" in this setting.

Currencies.Title: Currencies
Currencies.Label: Configure Currencies
Currencies.Hint: This setting define the currencies that are eligible for pickup, which may not be actual items but numerical inputs on the character sheet.

SecondaryCurrencies.Title: Secondary Currencies
SecondaryCurrencies.Label: Configure Secondary Currencies
SecondaryCurrencies.Hint: This setting define secondary currencies, similar to but separate from regular currencies. These cannot have exchange rates or be split into other custom currencies.

CurrencyDecimalDigits.Title: Currency Decimal Digits
CurrencyDecimalDigits.Hint: This setting defines the lowest decimal digit your currencies round to. For example in a modern setting with modern currencies, '0.01' allows for two decimal digits. This is not used if you have more than one currency.

ItemFilters.Title: Item filters
ItemFilters.Label: Configure Item Filters
ItemFilters.Hint: Here you can configure what items are ignored and not listed in the item pile dialogs.

ItemSimilarities.Title: Item Similarities
ItemSimilarities.Label: Configure Item Similarities
ItemSimilarities.Hint: Here you can configure how items are detected to be the same in this system. Some systems may have data that distinguishes items differently than others, such as temporary items.

UnstackableItemTypes.Title: Unstackable Item Types
UnstackableItemTypes.Label: Configure Unstackable Types
UnstackableItemTypes.Hint: Here you can configure which types of items are considered to be unique, no matter what. The types configured here cannot be stacked and can only ever have a quantity of 1.

CssVariables.Title: CSS Variables Styles
CssVariables.Label: Configure CSS Variables
CssVariables.Hint: This allows you to configure the various CSS variables that drive the colors and other styles within item piles' interfaces.

VaultStyles.Title: Vault Styles
VaultStyles.Label: Configure Vault Styles
VaultStyles.Hint: This allows you to add rules that will style items based on property paths and values on the items themselves.

PricePresets.Title: Price Presets
PricePresets.Label: Configure Price Presets
PricePresets.Hint: Here you can configure custom preset prices that you can then easily import onto items.

CustomItemCategories.Title: Custom Item Categories
CustomItemCategories.Label: Configure Item Categories
CustomItemCategories.Hint: In this, you can configure the custom item categories, which are shown as suggestions in the item editor.

EnableDroppingItems.Title: Enable Dropping Items
EnableDroppingItems.Hint: This enables users being able to drop items on the ground to create their own item piles - with this disabled, users cannot create new piles.

EnableGivingItems.Title: Enable Giving Items
EnableGivingItems.Hint: This enables users to be able to drop items onto other tokens to give it to them - with this disabled, users cannot give other users items.

EnableTrading.Title: Enable Trading
EnableTrading.Hint: This enables trading - with this disabled, no one can initiate any trade.

ShowTradeButton.Title: Show Trade Button
ShowTradeButton.Hint: Enabling this will display a trade button just below the player list in the bottom right.

InspectItemsTrade.Title: Enable Inspecting Items During Trades
InspectItemsTrade.Hint: Enabling this makes it so that users can click items that are being traded and open the item's sheet to preview them.

OutputToChat.Title: Output to chat
OutputToChat.Hint: Whenever any player picks up items from an item pile, this will send a message showing what was picked up.
OutputToChat.SelfGM: Private - only GMs and user can see messages
OutputToChat.Blind: Blind - only GMs can see messages

HideTokenBorder.Title: Hide Token Borders Of Item Piles
HideTokenBorder.Hint: This controls whether the token border is hidden when hovering over item pile tokens. Selecting the token always shows the border.

InvertSheetOpen.Title: Invert Ctrl + Double Click Open
InvertSheetOpen.Hint: Normally, you have to hold control when you want to open an item pile's actor sheet. Enabling this makes the item pile actor sheet open by default, and holding control opens the item pile inventory UI.

HideHeaderButtonText.Title: Hide header button text
HideHeaderButtonText.Hint: Hides the "Item Piles" text in the actor and item headers - useful if you have too many modules, and the header is getting crowded.

HideHeaderButton.Title: Hide header button
HideHeaderButton.Hint: Hides the "Item Piles" button in the actor and item headers. This will make it harder for you to configure new item piles and items.

DeleteEmptyPiles.Title: Auto-delete empty piles
DeleteEmptyPiles.Hint: This causes item piles to delete themselves once they run out of items. This can be overridden on individual item piles.

PreloadFiles.Title: Preload Files
PreloadFiles.Hint: Causes files (images and audio) of piles to be preloaded, resulting in a seamless experience.

Debug.Title: Enable debugging
Debug.Hint: Prints debug messages to the console

DebugHooks.Title: Enable debugging of hooks
DebugHooks.Hint: Prints the item pile hooks and their contents to the console

PopulationTablesFolder.Title: RollTables folder for "Populate Items"
PopulationTablesFolder.Hint: Folder title for filtering rolltables in merchant's "Populate Items" tab.
